intro: Nemcia dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf nemcia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
